result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany M Klever was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation. To be paid before costs or fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with the co-defendant (other than child issues) or with any victims or victim businesses listed in the criminal complaint. Case 15CF0357 was dismissed and read in. 
Not to use or possess any personal identification information other than her own. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.
03/29/2018 COURT GRANTS 14 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT

Defendant Brittany M Klever in court with Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing an restitution hearing.  Attorney Ehrfurth states that parties have reached a stipulation - stipulating to restitution in the amount of $2,187.98.  State agrees.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS    ** May be transferred to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendant (other than child issues) or with victims or victim business listed in criminal complaint
____Not to use or possess any personal identification information other than her own
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $2,187.98 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  5 Months, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

**Defense's request for expungment is denied**
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
